Description: Fragment of Attic red-figured pottery open vase (kantharos?); satyr walking to left, a wine skin in his lowered left hand, perhaps a drinking horn in his outstretched right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 130, no. 360.5, pl. XXXIX)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 235, no. 217) (Labels registration number as 4786)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1732)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4797 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
